name: Kopi Korner (Harbourfront Centre) | Traditional Coffee | Wide range of Singapore Local Delights |

reviews.text: It was only our second time trying Kaya Toast & Kopi but this was a great option. Modestly priced, quick service, great flavour, served in cute dishes.
Great local food at reasonable prices. Got the chicken curry which is so on point and goes well with the crunch baguette bread. Mee Siam is also full of flavour. Pairs well with the tea and kopi

Cashier Auntie with grey hair and green nail polish, $5.80 I got my half boiled egg yolks with spoon thrown on my yolk.Other places wonâ€™t even throw the spoon in. Not to mention broke my eggs with bare hands green nail polish. The other Chinese  staff much better helpful attitude. Only 1 more other customer besides me in the whole place - so place was still quite empty. Last time I will come here.
Westmall Bukit Batok outlet staffs attitude much friendlier.
Ok so they guy said its halal when he served us but no certificate. We only ordered tea and paratha . The tea was awful ..... never again. Guy behind the till and lady was super unfriendly

I only drank their kopi o kosong. Taste weird n not even nice. Maybe will come back later to try their mee siam since most review give good review on tis dish. By the way.. I saw the staff came out to clean the tables n tidy the chairs when they are free. Tis is a plus point.
